definition: zero/nought/zero sign/fractional/fragmentary/odd (of numbers)/(placed between two numbers to indicate a smaller quantity followed by a larger one)/fraction/(in mathematics) remainder (after division)/extra/to wither and fall/to wither
to sell/to make or carry out (a plan or intrigue etc)
commerce/merchant/dealer/to consult/2nd note in pentatonic scale/quotient (as in 智商[zhi4 shang1], intelligence quotient)

sentences.english: It's little surprise then that there's not much incentive for retailers and e-tailers to challenge the status quo.
sentences.chinese: 零售商和網售商挑戰出新的動機不大，一點也不奇怪。

sentences.english: Food retailers have cashed in on this opportunity with zeal.
sentences.chinese: 食品零售商懷着熱情利用了這一商機。

sentences.english: His father apprenticed him to a linen draper.
sentences.chinese: 他父親把他送去跟亞麻織品零售商當學徒。

sentences.english: Liebmann. "Retailers are going to have to work very hard to create that emotional feeling again."
sentences.chinese: 零售商正努力再創造出這種動人的感覺。

sentences.english: Some of the Asian vendors are hardly household names.
sentences.chinese: 其中一些亞洲零售商幾乎名不經傳。

sentences.english: Many retailers offer online deals for Black Friday.
sentences.chinese: 很多零售商人會在耶穌受難日提供網上交易。

sentences.english: He set up shop as a retail tobacconist in the High Street.
sentences.chinese: 他在哈艾大街開業做菸草零售商。

sentences.english: Book Retailers U. K. Industry R…
sentences.chinese: 英國圖書零售商行業研究報告。

sentences.english: Coffee retailer becomes latest food and beverage company to spread the wealth to investors.
sentences.chinese: 咖啡零售商最近成爲散佈投資者財富的餐飲公司。

sentences.english: Wholesalers and retailers can find new markets.
sentences.chinese: 批發商和零售商可以找到新的市場。

sentences.english: Retailers are hoping for brisk post-holiday sales.
sentences.chinese: 零售商麼希望振興節後市場銷售。

sentences.english: Long ago, tradesmen sold things in large cloth bags.
sentences.chinese: 很久以前，零售商用巨大的布袋子販賣東西。

sentences.english: Mr. Wattles has experience with a struggling retailer.
sentences.chinese: 威特斯在挽救陷入困境的零售商方面很有一套。

sentences.english: Retailers depend on local government for a licence and a place to operate.
sentences.chinese: 零售商們倚賴當地政府給予營業執照和場所去運營。

sentences.english: Being the world's largest retailer and a notorious discounter.
sentences.chinese: 世界上最大的零售商和一個臭名昭著的折扣者。

sentences.english: This would allow retailers to trace the meat to back to a cloned source.
sentences.chinese: 這也能使零售商追述到肉製品的克隆來源。

definition: brick and mortar business/physical (rather than online) retail store
e-commerce (abbr. for 電子商務|电子商务[dian4 zi3 shang1 wu4])/(old) to negotiate by telegram or telephone
to retail/to sell individually or in small quantities
